New Records: Harry Kane has now scored more goals at major tournaments than any other England player with 13.
Harry Kane is now level with Michael Owen and Wayne Rooney as the players to score for England at the most major tournaments, with four apiece.
Key Match Events: Harry Kane scored in the 18th minute with a left-footed shot from close range.
Morten Hjulmand equalized for Denmark in the 34th minute with a long-range shot that ricocheted off the left post and into the net.
Phil Foden hit the post in the second half.
Post-Match Reflections: Harry Kane acknowledged the team's need for improvement and anticipated disappointment back home.
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg expressed frustration at not securing a win despite his man of the match award.
Kieran Trippier emphasized the need for the team to stay together and improve.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was attended by the Prince of Wales and Denmark's King Frederik.
The attendance for the match was 46,177.
The match took place at Deutsche Bank Park in Frankfurt, Germany.
